half_double_crochet and double_crochet row see how stitch height changes the look and feel practice reading your work and keeping row in the correct order by the end of the 12 days you ll have practiced basic stitches single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet loop placement blo flo working into chain spaces simple textures moss lemon peel esc pg 3 www hodgepodge-crochet com pattern stitches v_stitch granny crossed double_crochet keeping a steady stitch count and neat edges assembling the bag each side of the bag is made from 6 blocks layout 3 blocks wide × 2 blocks tall you will make 2 panels like this front and back joining the squares you ll learn up to three different joining methods and can choose your favorite 1 whip stitch join with a yarn needle o flat soft seam o good if you want the joins to disappear 2 slip_stitch join with your hook o thin neat join with a small ridge o good if you like a delicate raised line 3 single_crochet join with your hook o chunky raised ridge between squares o good if you want the join to be a design feature you ll join the 3 squares in the top row the 3 squares in the bottom row then join the two row together you ll repeat this to make two panels edging and handles once each panel is assembled 1 you ll learn how to work neat edging across the top o 4 row of single_crochet 2 you ll learn to build a simple handle using chains o single_crochet in the first 10 sts o long chain for the handle o skip the middle stitches o single_crochet into the last 10 sts o then single_crochet into all stitches and chains to thicken the strap 3 you ll add a few more single_crochet row to make the top stronger 4 you ll finish with a loose slip_stitch row for a clean edge you ll repeat the edging + handle on both panels joining the panels into a bag last you ll place the two panels together with the outsides facing in seam the sides and bottom using your chosen join method pg 4 www hodgepodge-crochet com turn the bag right side out so the handles and seams show nicely at the end of this cal you will have practiced 12 stitch ideas learned multiple ways to join squares learned how to add edging and handles and finished a handmade
